message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.MM, cs.CR 

The paper proposes a novel approach for person re-identification using graph correspondence transfer. This involves learning correspondence templates from positive training pairs and transferring correspondences to test pairs for feature distance calculation. The approach is evaluated on five benchmarks and achieves superior performance compared to state-of-the-art methods. Given the focus on computer vision and machine learning techniques, the most likely sub-category is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). The paper also involves learning from data and optimization, which suggests possible sub-categories of cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). The use of image and video data suggests a possible sub-category of cs.MM (Multimedia). Finally, the paper involves evaluating the performance of the proposed approach, which suggests a possible sub-category of cs.CR (Cryptography and Security).
